com.sterlingcommerce.ui.web.framework.context

Class SCUIContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sterlingcommerce.ui.web.framework.context.SCUIContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SCUIContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    SCUIContext class encapsulates the security related attributes in SCUISecurityContext, SCUIUserPreferences, transaction related behavior in SCUITransactionContext, request and response object in Web Context and data related to the UI in SCUIGUIDataContext object. These Contexts are expected and used for security, transactions and transfer / manipulation of data. rasrinivasan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SCUIContext(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Constructor that takes in the HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse to set the SCUIWebContext.

        public javax.servlet.http.HttpSession getSession(boolean create)
        getter for the HttpSession with an option to not create anew session. create - true to create a new session for this request if necessary; false to return null if there's no current session of type HttpSession from the WebContext

      • getTransactionContext

        public ISCUITransactionContext getTransactionContext()
        This method returns current TransactionContext for the same request. This method should be used when one wants be sure that no new TransactionContext is created. TransactionContext type of ISCUITransactionContext

      • getTransactionContext

        public ISCUITransactionContext getTransactionContext(boolean create)
        This method returns current TransactionContext for the same request. If no transaction context is found associated with the same request, and true is passed as parameter, a new transaction context is fetched using transaction context helper and returned. If parameter passed is true, a new transaction context is create if not found. create TransactionContext type of ISCUITransactionContext

      • removeTransactionContext

        public void removeTransactionContext()
        This method removes current TranactionContext from the request. This method should be called after closing a TransactonContext.

      • replaceAttribute

        public void replaceAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                             java.lang.Object value)
        This method sets an attribute value in the request. This method need to be used if the attribute with the key already exists in the request. key of the type String value as Object

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.Object value)
        This method sets an attribute value in the request. This method need to be used instead of directly setting values on request. This method will NOT replace if an attribute with same key already exists. key of the type String value as Object SCUIAttributeExistsException if the attribute with same key exists

      • setTransactionContext

        public void setTransactionContext(ISCUITransactionContext transactionContext)
        This method sets transaction context on the request scope. If there is already one transaction context set on the request, this method throws an exception. transactionContext of type ISCUITransactionContext

      • getApplicationSecurityContext

        public java.io.Serializable getApplicationSecurityContext()
        Getter for application's security context. This will be fetched from the session. It is stored in session as the value for the attribute key 'SCUI_APP_SECURITY_CONTEXT'. application's security context object

      • setApplicationSecurityContext

        public void setApplicationSecurityContext(java.io.Serializable appSecurityContext)
        Modifier for application's security context. It is stored in session as the value for the attribute key 'SCUI_APP_SECURITY_CONTEXT'. appSecurityContext

      • getTransactionDataMap

        public java.util.Map getTransactionDataMap()
        Returns a non-null tarnsactionDataMap. The data is maintained in the session.

        NOTE: before setting any data, user should check whether it is already set in the map. Users should directly modify the Map returned by this method
